document.docAuthor: Bastida-Zavala, J. Rolando, McCANN, Linda D., Keppel, Erica & Ruiz, Gregory M.
document.masterDocTitle: The fouling serpulids (Polychaeta: Serpulidae) from United States coastal waters: an overview

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The fouling serpulids (Polychaeta: Serpulidae) from United States coastal waters: an overview

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pomatoleios cariniferus var. Kraussii
Baird, 1865: 13–15
( type locality: Promontorio Bonae Spei [= Cape of Good Hope], South Africa ).

Pomatoleios crosslandi Pixell, 1913: 85–86
, pl. 9, fig. 10 ( type locality: Ras Shangani and Chwaka, Zanzibar , Tanzania , East Africa).

Pomatoleios kraussii
–

, fig. 38.3a–f, Cape and Natal (now KwaZulu-Natal ), South Africa and Mozambique ). —

( Queensland , Australia ; intertidal; forming colonies). —

(Coconut Island (or Moku o Loʻe), Hawaii; intertidal to 1.5 m ; rocks and coral rubble on reef flat and on fouling plates). —

(Tanegashima Island, southern Japan ). —

(Oahu Island, Maui Island and Hawaii Island; rocky intertidal, reef flats, epifauna of mobile substrata (mollusks and crustaceans) and boat harbors). —

(Ogasawara Islands, southern Japan ; intertidal; on reefs and rocks in sheltered areas). —

, fig. 3a–j (Ō-shima Island, southern Japan ; intertidal). —

(Sabiura and near Andonohana, Shionomisaki Cape, southern Japan ; intertidal, on rock). —

(Toulon, France : on hull of the aircraft carrier “Foch” and the navy ship “Balny” after returning from Indian Ocean missions via the Suez Canal and western Africa, respectively). —

(Arumizu Bay, Palau Islands). —

, fig. 3.11.193 (Hawaii; on intertidal reefs flats and in shallow subtidal waters). —

, figs 1–2 ( Okinawa Island, Southwest Japan ; fouling on piers and concrete wall). —

S. haemastoma

, fig. 12A–F ( Hong Kong ; intertidal to 1 m ; rocky bottom). —

(Hawaii; introduction confirmed).

Serpula columbiana
. A . Operculum, from Ketchikan Bay, Alaska (SERC-81981). B . Operculum, adult from San Diego, California (LACMNH-Poly4928);. –
Spirobranchus kraussii
. C-D . Operculum and tube fragment, from Oahu, Hawaii (SERC-114603). E . Colony, from Natal, South Africa (LACMNH-N5217). –
S. minutus
. F . Tube, from Santa Catarina, Brazil (USNM-43239). G . Operculum, From Tampa Bay, Florida (SERC-93759). Types of collar chaetae. H–J . Bayonet. K . Bayonet with proximal rasp. L . Capillaries. M . Limbate. N . Fin-andblade chaetae. O . Coarsely serrated. –

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pomatoleios crosslandi
–
Lakshmana Rao 1969: 9–10
, pl. 7, figs a–e (Visakhapatnam, Madras, now Chennai, and Bombay , now Mumbai , India ; harbours).

Spirobranchus kraussii
–
Pillai 2009: 146–148
, 168, fig. 49E–G, new combination ( United Arab Emirates , Persian Gulf).

subSubSection.paragraph: More than 100 specimens : colony, from Umhlali, Natal, South Africa ( LACMNH-N 5217).

Specimens from Natal, South Africa (LACMNH-N5217), build colonies; however, material from this locality differed slightly from our specimen (from Hawaii) and from the original description in that the tubes have two longitudinal ridges ending in a flap above the mouth of the tube ( Fig. 9E ), while our only specimen had a single longitudinal ridge. This was in line with the original description which says “…dorsal keel is perhaps rather flatter and less sharp-pointed at its extremity” ( Baird 1865: 15 ). Comparison of the different populations of
Spirobranchus kraussii
from the Indian Ocean, the western Pacific and Hawaii should be reexamined together to facilitate a genus revision.

The nominal species has an Indo-Pacific distribution: South Africa , Mozambique , Tanzania , Red Sea, Persian Gulf, India , Australia , southern Japan , Palau Island , Hawaii ( Pixell 1913 ; Day 1967 ; Straughan 1967 , 1969 ; Ishaq & Mustaquim 1996 ; Pillai 2009 ); and as NIS in the Mediterranean Sea ( Zibrowius 1979 ; Ben-Eliahu & ten Hove 1992 ). In this survey, only one specimen of
Spirobranchus kraussii
was found, on a fouling plate from Oahu, Hawaii ( Fig. 10 ).
